Key Match Events: A pair of homers in a three-run eighth inning led the Milwaukee Brewers to a 5–3 comeback victory over the New York Mets Wednesday night
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Pat Murphy: "A lot of contributors, a lot of guys gave us what they had, and they didn’t quit."
Garrett Mitchell: "We just continue to fight. It doesn’t matter the score, doesn’t matter how many outs, doesn’t matter the situation. We’re ready to go."
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game went to a winner-take-all third game
Others: The Brewers came back from two separate deficits to win the game
The Brewers' relief pitchers held the Mets scoreless the whole way
The Mets left nine men on base, seven in scoring position
